title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
this came in botched from another store without smc.
Replaced smc, and i got green light now., but board still not turning on.
pp5v_s5 : 5v
pp3v3_s5 : 2.9v ( strange )
ppvrtc_g3h : 2.9v ( strange too)
ppbus_G3h : 12.6v
I have tried replacing tps, but still no luck.
any pointer ? thanks..

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
U7200 gets hot?
Check R7269/70 ohm values and resolder all around U7200.
What about RTC signals?

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
the whole board is cool.
u7200justtt a bittt of warm.
r7269 and r7270 is 5k ohm each.
all around u7200 and u7200 itself has been resoldered and rock solid.

all around u2600 is perfect too.

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
You cannot propely check the resistor value onboard.
If needed, play with RC/RD divider, until get correct 3V3_S5.

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
hmm.
i tried to play with rc rd, at first, I wire r7270, but I got 2v.
i thought, ok, lowering resistance give me lower value, lets replace with higher rating resistor. so I gave 15k ohm resistor to r7270.
but voltage is like 200mv.
Im confused.

for r7269, from board view its connected to ground. but according to schematic, theres no ground on either pin 1/2 of r7269.
so I tried to wire it, but voltage is gone, so I replace r7269 back.

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
According to SCHEMATIC, pin 2/R7269 goes to ground through XW7201.

The formula from the schematic shows that increasing R7270 (RC) value, will increase VOUT (3V3_S5).

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
hi, can we start over ?
i dont have pp3v3_s5 now, I have put everything back.
I have smc_pm_g2_en, but s5_pwrgd is 0v.
p5v3v3_reg_en is present, but pp3v3_s5_reg isnt present. is it because of missing s5 pwrgd ?
I have tried replacing u7941.

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
S5_PWRGD is a power good signal, which will come high ONLY when 3V3_S5 is present.

Replaca R7269/70 and check all solders and traces.

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
i see..
replaced  r7269 and r7270 to original value. and back to square one. pp3v3_s5 is 2.9-3.0v
any advice for r7270 value ? is 100k too much ?

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
What do you expect, increasing from 6.5K to 100K (15x aprox)???
Try 7.5-8.2K...

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
i try 8.2k, pp3v3_s5 is 3.0v.
still not enough i think, if i use 15k, the voltage is gone ( 0v)

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
You may have broken traces now.
Check if R7269 is still OK (10K).

title: 820-3115 not turning on
message:
THANKSSS A LOTTT!!
Pin 9 of u7200 to r7220 is actually broken, the broken trace is camouflaged so well.
you told me to check, so i have to do it with resistance mode to all trace.
when i see resistance so huge, turn out there's small crater.
i will be more careful next time, thanks a lot!!
